intro: Scorzonera musilii, commonly known as the Italian scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Scorzonera musilii is often found in dry, rocky soils and is valued for its edible roots and ornamental appeal.
